questions.question: A primary radar has a pulse repetition frequency of 275 pps. The time interval between the leading edges of successive pulses is:
questions.explanation: PRI (Pulse Repetition Interval) = 1 / PRF = 1 / 275 = 0.00364 seconds = 3.64 milliseconds. This is the time between the leading edges of successive pulses.

questions.question: A primary radar system has a pulse repetition frequency of 450 pps. Ignoring pulse width and flyback at the CRT, the maximum range of the radar would be:
questions.explanation: Maximum range = c / (2 × PRF). With PRF = 450 pps: Range = (3 × 10⁸) / (2 × 450) = 333,333 m = 333 km = 180 NM (333 / 1.852).

questions.question: The frequency band and rate of scan of Airfield Surface Movement radars are:
questions.explanation: Airfield Surface Movement Indicators (ASMI) operate in the SHF (Super High Frequency) band, typically around 9-10 GHz, and have a scanner rotation rate of 60 rpm (revolutions per minute) to provide frequent updates of surface traffic.

questions.question: A ground based radar with a scanner rotation of 60 rpm, a beamwidth in the order of 0.5° and a PRF of 10000 pps would be:
options: a. an Airfield Surface Movement Indicator with a theoretical range of 8 NM
c. an Airfield Surface Movement Indicator with a theoretical range of 16 NM
d. a high resolution Surveillance Approach Radar
questions.explanation: An Airfield Surface Movement Indicator (ASMI) has: 60 rpm rotation, narrow beamwidth (0.5°), and high PRF (10,000 pps) for short-range, high-resolution surface surveillance. Maximum range = c / (2 × PRF) = (3 × 10⁸) / (2 × 10,000) = 15,000 m = 8.1 NM ≈ 8 NM.
